intro: Calyptranthes zuzygium, commonly known as the Zuzigum calyptranthes, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other well-known plants such as eucalyptus and guava. The plant is characterized by its dense, glossy green leaves and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a small, woody capsule that contains several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical and subtropical gardens.
